question: Can I afford a $250,000 home loan with an annual income of $75,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an income of $75,000 and monthly debts of $1,000, you can afford a $250,000 loan. Estimates suggest a DTI of 33%.

steps.content: Can I afford a $250,000 home loan with an annual income of $75,000 and monthly debts of $1,000?
Plan: 1) Calculate affordability with home_loan_agent. 2) Retrieve debt-to-income knowledge. 3) Use calculator for DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Return answer.
Retrieving knowledge on home loan affordability criteria.
Affordability is determined by income, credit score, and debt-to-income (DTI) ratio typically below 43%.
DTI calculated at 33% with monthly income of $6,250 and $1,000 in debts.
What kind of interest rate would I be looking at?
Current average interest rates for a 30-year fixed loan are around 3.5% to 4%.
With a good credit score, you may qualify for lower rates within these averages.
Would this be manageable with my current expenses?
Based on your income and expenses, this loan seems manageable.
Review complete, all calculations and checks passed.
Yes, with an income of $75,000 and monthly debts of $1,000, you can afford a $250,000 loan. Estimates suggest a DTI of 33%.
